name: EFS Ontology (Enterprise Framework Services)
description: Enterprise Framework Services ontology for agile product development, backlog management, and value delivery specification. End of VE lineage chain: VSOM → OKR → VP → PMF → EFS

components.BacklogItem: Abstract base class for all specification items in the product backlog hierarchy
components.Epic: Large body of work broken into features, aligned to strategic objectives
components.Feature: Functionality delivering business value within an Epic scope
components.UserStory: Desired functionality from user perspective with acceptance criteria
components.Enabler: Technical infrastructure work enabling future feature delivery
components.Task: Atomic unit of work within a UserStory or Enabler
components.AcceptanceCriterion: Measurable condition defining Story or Feature completion
components.Outcome: Measurable business result achieved through Epic delivery
components.Hypothesis: Testable assumption linking an Epic to expected Outcomes
components.Capability: Cross-cutting technical or business ability enabled by Features
components.Dependency: Blocking or enabling relationship between BacklogItems
components.Risk: Identified threat to BacklogItem delivery or value realisation
components.Persona: Fictional character representing user type for story authoring
components.Theme: Strategic grouping of Epics aligned to business objectives
components.Team: Cross-functional group responsible for Sprint delivery
components.Stakeholder: Individual or group with interest in Benefit realisation

crossOntology.name: receivesFromPPM
crossOntology.purpose: PPM → EFS: Projects decompose into Epics

crossOntology.name: receivesFromPMF
crossOntology.purpose: PMF → EFS: Customer segments inform Persona definitions

crossOntology.name: alignsToObjective
crossOntology.purpose: EFS → VSOM: Epics trace to strategic objectives

crossOntology.name: enablesExecution
crossOntology.purpose: PMF → EFS lineage: validated PMF drives Epic creation

crossOntology.name: mapsToEpic
crossOntology.purpose: VP → EFS: Problems map to Epics

crossOntology.name: manifestsAsPersona
crossOntology.purpose: VP → EFS: ICP to Persona mapping

crossOntology.name: realizesInStory
crossOntology.purpose: VP → EFS: Benefits realised through UserStories

versionHistory.changes: Full OAA v5 compliance, VE-PE lineage integration, unified glossary reference
OAA v6.1.0 upgrade: 28 relationships (single connected component), 11 business rules, cross-ontology references for PPM/PMF/VSOM bridges, all 19 entities fully connected

notes: End of VE lineage chain. Receives validated requirements from PMF and connects to PE-Process-Engr-ONT for execution.
